metadata.title: USN-7048-1 -- Vim vulnerability
metadata.description: Suyue Guo discovered that Vim incorrectly handled memory when flushing the typeahead buffer, leading to heap-buffer-overflow. An attacker could  possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-7048-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  vim - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.19 vim-athena - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.19 vim-common - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.19 vim-doc - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.19 vim-gtk - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.19 vim-gtk3 - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.19 vim-gui-common - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.19 vim-nox - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.19 vim-runtime - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.19 vim-tiny - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.19 xxd - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.19 No subscription required
